ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Learning hands-on about mineral deposits and their formation.

This class is very approachable and interesting, and I would certainly recommend it! It's probably best to have a strong background in mineralogy and basic structural geology; without this background knowledge I would have been lost most of the time. It's a pretty unique course in G&G because it fuses mineralogy&petrology with economics and history; this interdisciplinary nature makes it especially engaging.

Mineral deposits is a great class. I can't imagine taking it with anyone else besides Professor Skinner, who is a legendary professor for a reason and really cares about his students. But, I'll also say this-- this was my first geology class, and although it was very intense and indepth, I had a great experience with it because of very friendly classmates and Professor Skinner. G&G students, more than students in any other major that I've met in my last 4 years, really create a community and collaborative approach to studying. The class was an enormously pleasant experience.
